meanings.definition: A person or thing that bolsters or supports.
meanings.sent1: The bolsterer helped hold up the heavy bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: The pillow acted as a comfortable bolsterer for her back.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy dog became an unexpected bolsterer for the tired child.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words served as a mental bolsterer during the challenging times.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy tree trunk stood as a natural bolsterer for the fragile sapling.

meanings.definition: One who provides support or reinforcement.
meanings.sent1: As a loyal friend, she was always a reliable bolsterer in times of need.
meanings.sent2: The mentor acted as a helpful bolsterer for the new employees.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was seen as a powerful bolsterer of justice in the city.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude served as a mental bolsterer for the team.
meanings.sent5: The strong foundation of the building acted as a crucial bolsterer against earthquakes.

meanings.sent1: She would often bolsterer her friend's confidence before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The additional evidence helped bolsterer the case against the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to bolsterer the flavor of the soup with extra spices.
meanings.sent4: His words of encouragement were meant to bolsterer her determination to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew worked hard to bolsterer the weakened bridge before it collapsed.
